meanings.definition: To divide into parcels or packages.
meanings.sent1: She was parcelling the gifts for her friends.
meanings.sent2: The post office is parcelling the packages for delivery.
meanings.sent3: The children were parcelling up their toys to donate to charity.
meanings.sent4: The chef was parcelling the ingredients for the recipe.
meanings.sent5: He carefully wrapped each item, parcelling them neatly.

meanings.definition: To distribute or allocate in portions.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was parcelling out the worksheets to the students.
meanings.sent2: The organization is parcelling out food to those in need.
meanings.sent3: The team captain was parcelling out the playing time fairly.
meanings.sent4: She was parcelling out advice to her friends.
meanings.sent5: The manager was parcelling out tasks to the employees.

meanings.definition: The act of dividing into parcels or packages.
meanings.sent1: The parcelling of the items was done efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The parcelling of the products was completed ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The parcelling of the gifts brought joy to the recipients.
meanings.sent4: The parcelling of the supplies was meticulous.
meanings.sent5: The parcelling of the boxes was a team effort.
